title: STLGameDev Spring Game Jam 2025!
description:
Spring is almost over already and we're overdue for another game jam! So team up with local creators and make a game over a few weekends (and the week in between)!

This jam will be **virtual only**. **[SIGN UP ON ITCH.IO!](https://itch.io/jam/stlgamedev-spring-jam)**
We would like to encourage everyone to collaborate with local devs in person if possible. We think jamming in person is just more fun. To find teammates and stay up to date on event details, **join our [Discord server](https://discord.gg/mTMKpre)!** If you must, you can work with remote friends as well. Students, hobbyists, and professionals are all welcome to submit games.

All participants must abide by the [STLGameDev Community Guidelines](https://stlgame.dev/about/#community-guidelines).

**A theme will be announced at the start of the jam.**

**EVENT SCHEDULE**

***FRIDAY MAY 23***

* 6:00 PM - Keynote & Theme Reveal streamed online on [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/STLGameDev)

***SUNDAY JUNE 1***

* 5:00 PM - Game submission deadline
* 7:00 PM - Game demos streamed online on [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/STLGameDev)

title: Game Audio Club: Music Show & Tell!
description:
**Sat 5/24 - *Music Show & Tell!***
Bring one piece of music to share. You can:

* Just play it and get feedback

and / or

* Show us your notes, DAW files, or sheet music if you’d like

**Available Equipment:**

* Speakers + a TV with an HDMI cable to play your music
* An upright acoustic piano & an electric piano if you want to perform live

**Send your recordings** to **lazcomposer@gmail.com** by the night before—**Friday, 5/23**, so that I can play your songs on my computer (I have the drivers for my Focusrite on my laptop for the monitor speakers).

Can’t wait to hear what everyone’s been working on!

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**Game Audio Club Overview:**

If you’re into making video game music or sound design (or just curious) come hang out with us once a month! Doesn’t matter if you’re a pro or just starting out— everyone’s welcome. Just bring your love for game audio.
We’re a chill group where you can share your work, get feedback, or just vibe with people who love game audio.

**Stuff We Do:**

* Show off what we’re working on (or just listen)
* Talk about how to write music for different game moments
* Mess around with making sound effects
* Give mini-presentations (if you’re into that)
* Share random ideas and nerd out
* Watch videos, play games, and pick apart the audio
* Basically, anything cool related to game sounds

**Some snacks will be available**. Bringing snacks to share is encouraged!

**Parking:**

Parking is available in the side parking lot behind the big Montessori Training Center & Lab Schools sign or on the street. The school that our event will being taking place wil be located on the left of the big sign. Please enter the building from the front door.

Hope to see you there!

title: Game Club: Baba Is You
description:
Game Club is like a book club except we pick a game to play each month and then meet up to discuss it with a focus on game design.

To keep the group budget-friendly, games we play are generally under $15. Each month we randomly select someone in the group to pick a few game options and then we vote on which one to play for the month. You must attend a meeting to be selected, and voting is done on our [Discord server](https://discord.gg/mTMKpre).

This month's game is **[Baba Is You](https://store.steampowered.com/app/736260/Baba_Is_You/)**, a brilliant puzzle game!
Come share your thoughts on the game with us!

title: Share & Play: Game Playtesting!
description:
Join us for casual game testing! This is an opportunity for developers to share their progress, observe playtesting, and get feedback on their projects, and for local game enthusiasts to get their hands on new games, prototypes, and give helpful feedback.

We encourage everyone to bring game projects that you are working on or recently finished to show off! Game jam games, video games, physical games, student projects, and everything in between!

**We will be in Meeting Room 2 in the library.**

Developers:
**You must bring your own demo hardware.** Laptops, notebooks, tablets, and mobile devices are encouraged. There may not be space for large gaming rigs and monitors.
**This event is specifically for testing games YOU are working on.** It is not a space to play the latest AAA games, games you did not work on, or games that you do not have consent to test in public.

**[Join us on Discord](https://discord.gg/mTMKpre)**

title: GameDev Social!
description:
Come chat with fellow creators about making, playing, and admiring games! Talk about your game ideas and get inspired! Make friends and find collaborators.

Our monthly hangout is open to EVERYONE. This is an all ages event, but minors must be accompanied by a parent or guardian. Alcoholic drinks are 100% optional. Dirty 20 has plenty of non-alcoholic drink options, yummy mac n' cheeses, and other munchies if you get hungry.

This is mainly a social event, but feel free to bring your sketchbook, tablet, laptop, or card/board game prototype to show off whatever you're working on! Table space is limited though, so please do not bring desktop computers or anything that will take up a lot of space.

This event is indoors and masks are not required. Please do not come if you have any symptoms of being sick or any recent exposure to others who are sick.
